profiles:
Experience Senior Global Cyber Security Engineer IBM July 2015  – Present (2 months) Washington D.C. Metro Area Cyber Security Staff Engineer Booz Allen Hamilton March 2014  –  July 2015  (1 year 5 months) Washington D.C. Metro Area Provided support for two Air Force Civil Engineering systems and five Navy Industrial Control Systems.  
•	Performed STIG testing during development of enterprise-wide application, including Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) 5/6, Oracle 11g, Apache 2.2, Web Policy, JRE 1.6(Java), Application Security and Development (ASD), and Security Readiness Review (SRR) checklists 
•	Used Microsoft Excel, IBM Clear Quest, and the Defense Information Systems Agency (DISA) STIG Viewer to track vulnerabilities used to minimize technical risks 
•	Performed system artifact updates to critical C&A documentation across multiple information assurance (IA) systems 
•	Tracked over 10,000 Security Technical Implementation Guide (STIG) checks with 100% accuracy; The result was I was able to craft a comprehensive Plan of Action and Milestones (POA&M) in eMASS to better present and track the security posture of the system.  
•	Created a new system topology from scratch in Visio. This system topology diagram received positive feedback from the Air Force Designated Accrediting Authority (DAA) outlined in the triage package 
•	Drafted a new system Data Transfer Standard Operating Procedure (SOP). The SOP describes the logical and functional flow of latitude and longitude GPS data from the system's handheld GPS devices to the system on the Air Force network whilst excluding unapproved USB devices, etc 
•	Reviewing Platform IT (PIT) C&A packages to ensure accuracy of security testing test results and documentations, prior to submitting the C&A package to the Navy ICS DAA for an Authority to Operate (ATO) 
•	Craft a comprehensive Plan of Action and Milestones (POA&M) in eMASS to better present and track the security posture of the system,following the Risk Management Framework (RMF) Senior Quality Assurance Coordinator Capital One July 2008  –  September 2013  (5 years 3 months) •	Assessed the Access Control effectiveness while considering the risks associated the business model 
•	Created Enhanced process and created proper documentation for future reference and accountability, which prevented Federal Regulatory violations against the organization while enhancing customer experience  
•	Audit multiple lines of business for Federal Regulation adherence within the Fraud Department 
•	Provide Regulation consulting services to various business customers while managing risks associated across the enterprise 
•	Forged and maintain client relationships Fraud Recovery Representative Capital One July 2006  –  July 2008  (2 years 1 month) •	Exceeded liquidation percentages for 12 consecutive months by implementing a tracking system that allowed the opportunity for proper system and time efficiency across the department 
•	Recovered Capital One funds lost due to fraud, managed investigations to determine the source of fraud 
•	Counseled Capital One credit card holders in distress due to fraudulent activity in their accounts and educated the clients in the legal issues regarding fraud 
•	Resolved credit card holders’ claims of fraud within deadlines while adhering to Federal Regulation compliance requirements Senior Global Cyber Security Engineer IBM July 2015  – Present (2 months) Washington D.C. Experience Cyber Security Engineer IBM August 2015  – Present (1 month) *Analyze, troubleshoot, and investigate security-related, information systems’ anomalies based on security platform reporting, network traffic, log files, host-based and automated security alerts. 
 
*Engineer, implement and monitor security measures for the protection of computer systems, networks and information 
 
*Maintain and update relevant system and process documentation and develop ad-hoc reports as needed 
 
*Assist the development of security tool requirements, trials, and evaluations, as well as security operations procedures and processes. 
 
*Successfully manage time and technical responsibilities, set accurate expectations and meet deliverable deadlines while working in a team and information sharing environment. 
 
*Analyze data and prepare reports that document vulnerabilities from network based attacks and recommends actions to prevent, repair or mitigate these vulnerabilities 
 
*Responsible for advancing the Cyber Threat practice across the firm through threat evaluations Senior Security Analyst IBM December 2014  – Present (9 months) *Administrate and monitor a strategic, comprehensive corporate and federal information security monitoring and operation program to ensure confidentiality, integrity and availability of information owned, controlled, and processed at SoftLayer, an IBM owned company, Security Operation Center (SOC) 
 
*Daily security activities related to the protection of corporate and other federal assets 
 
*Provide information to and monitor/act on information from various sources 
 
*Ensure that SoftLayer is in compliance with all applicable federal directives and policies regarding securing and monitoring of information  
 
*Risk assessment duties, including reporting and oversight of remediation efforts to address negative findings and management of outside assessors 
 
*Manage security incidents and events to protect corporate and federal assets Vulnerability Assessment Engineer SRA International July 2011  –  November 2014  (3 years 5 months) Fair Lakes, VA *Serve as the Vulnerability Assessment/Security Analyst at SRA's Security Operation Center (SOC) 
 
*Perform network (firewall, routers, switches), host (Windows, Unix/Linux, Mac), web application (SharePoint), and database (MSSQL, Oracle) vulnerability assessments to determine the threats/risks faced by the organization 
 
*Coordinate planning, scheduling and performing the security assessments 
 
*Analyze results, create reports and suggests mitigations for security vulnerabilities to technology managers 
 
*Be responsible for researching current vulnerabilities and exploits that pose a threat to the organization 
 
*Key player in patch process cycle group 
 
*Support security architecture review for various projects College Tech Spec Intern Lockheed Martin March 2011  –  June 2011  (4 months) *Support in extensive and early regression test activities with different operating systems, programs and patch releases which are directly related to customer deliverables 
 
*Assist in multiple security package integrations to ensure compliance with all dictated requirements 
 
*Edit, evaluate and go over technical documentations and procedural checklist for any mistakes and correct them when necessary Help Desk Associate SumaTech Consulting January 2010  –  March 2011  (1 year 3 months) *Serve as the first point of technical support for well over 450 clients 
 
*Diagnose and resolve technical, network, hardware, and software issues 
 
*Respond to requests for technician assistance using telephone and remote access 
 
*Create technical documentations to improve the company’s resource database 
 
*Identify and escalate situations requiring urgent attention to higher level 
 
*Track and route problems and requests, and document resolutions 
 
*Log all help desk interactions using helpdesk software interface 
 
*Advise clients on appropriate action(s) and manage inventory control 
 
*Research solutions using available information resources Easy-Tech Sales Associate Staples January 2006  –  December 2009  (4 years) *Ability to find solutions to customer electronics related problems, inventory management, stocking merchandise, changing and managing floor plans and price tags 
 
*Follow strict directions successfully on closing the store, cash handling, check and credit card money transactions and returns 
 
*Provided excellent customer service to clients 
Meet and exceed daily sales goals to improve store financial status 
 
*Had constant positive compliments given by clients according to the store's  
daily customer surveys Administrative Assistant JCS Engineering May 2007  –  May 2008  (1 year 1 month) *Ability to multitask and perform general office duties such as answering phone calls, printing, copying, faxing, scanning, signing for and sending out packages, ordering office supplies, light invoice and billing, distribute mail, greetings guests and data entry  
 
*Assist with projects using Microsoft Office suite.  
 
*Plotting, changing electrical inputs in engineering graphs by using softwares such as eTransmit, Rescheck in an effective manner 
 
*Learn basic engineering concepts and training in AutoCAD software to assist coworkers in an extensive way Cyber Security Engineer IBM August 2015  – Present (1 month) *Analyze, troubleshoot, and investigate security-related, information systems’ anomalies based on security platform reporting, network traffic, log files, host-based and automated security alerts.
